label: Qatar Charity UK
description:
QATAR CHARITY (QCUK) was established ostensibly because of a need to supervise growing QC projects in the UK & Europe

◆ From its inception, QCUK has had strong ties to the UK and European MUSLIM BROTHERHOOD and most of the known QCUK expenditures are being directed to MUSLIM BROTHERHOOD related projects in the UK and Europe

◆ Both European QCUK trustees, AYYOUB ABOULIAQIN and HAFEZ AHMAD AHMAD (aka HAFIZ KARMI), are important leaders in UK and European MUSLIM BROTHERHOOD organizations, with an apparent attempt made to obscure the true identity of AHMAD.

◆ The Sheffield, UK mosque complex being constructed by the EMAAN TRUST with the support of QCUK is the latest in a series of attempts by the EUROPE TRUST to covertly build large Islamic facilities in European cities controlled by the MUSLIM BROTHERHOOD.

◆ THe EMAAN TRUST Sheffield project appears to be focused on providing facilities for the Yemeni MUSLIM BROTHERHOOD in the UK and centers on UK converts to Islam.

◆ Most of the EMAAN TRUST officers have problematic ties to the UK and/or global MUSLIM BROTHERHOOD, Islamism, and/or extremism and terrorism.

label: Hameed Al-Asaly
description: HAMEED AL-ASALY, profiled below, of the Birmingham-based CATALYST REGENERATION (UK) LTD was described as managing the project which was reportedly to be funded by Sheffield Muslims, including former World boxing champion NASEEM HAMED. No further activity on the project appears to have taken place until September 2010 when a new planning department les was created with the applicant as HAMEED AL-ASALY who listed the AL-EMAAN TRUST as the company. Substantial work on the project began during the summer of 2013 and there were local rumors that £2 million had “disappeared” from the project, forcing the delay. Work was expected to have been completed in June 2016.
